instructions: Open the Voice Memos app. Either tap its icon on the iPhone Home screen or tell Siri to open it. Tap the large red button at the bottom of the screen to begin recording. As you record, the time and a recording indicator appear above the button, which changes its appearance to indicate that the iPhone is recording. Tap the button at the bottom of the screen to stop the recording. The recording is saved on the iPhone automatically. Highlight the default New Recording title that's located at the top of the screen and give it a descriptive name. Tap the Play/Pause , Forward , or Backward buttons that appear beneath the recording to review it. Tap the trash can to delete the recording. Tap the three-dot icon for additional options. The Share action in Voice Memos is particularly useful. Use it to share a recording by text message, email message, save it to iCloud Drive , or add it to a note in the Notes app. Other default choices are Copy, Edit, Duplicate, and Save to Files. To customize these menu items, tap Edit Actions to make changes in the Actions screen, then tap Done to save the changes and return to the Voice Memos home screen.

Tap Settings on the iPhone Home screen. Select Voice Memos . Next to Audio Quality , select either Compressed or Lossless . Compressed is suitable for most voice notes or conversations, and it delivers acceptable quality in a small size. Select Lossless when high quality is important, and size is not a concern. Review the other settings and change the defaults as needed.

Tap the memo you plan to edit, then select the three-dot icon. Choose Edit Recording . Use your finger to swipe left or right until you reach the beginning of the part you want to record over, as indicated by the blue line. Tap Replace . Record over part of the memo, then tap the Pause icon when you're finished. Tap Done to save the edited recording.
